s.text: More importantly, talking with a news subject about a possible job is not always grounds for dismissal on Lehrer's show, which has not been so severe with commentator David Gergen, who while still on the show talked to Bill Clinton about coming to work for him before actually doing so.
First of all, Taylor came right out and said these talks had taken place.
The WP coverage refers to the substance as a "Vietnam-era" weapon and states that the U.S. military discontinued its use a quarter century ago.

The paper notes that although the FCC's affirmative action hiring goals also target women, this decision does not address those, although experts say the decision will probably lead to eventual challenges of them as well.
It remains curious to "Today's Papers" however, that plays and books (and string quartets) can win journalism's most esteemed prize, but magazines cannot.
